intro: Prenanthes polymorpha, commonly known as the common water hemp, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in wet or moist habitats such as marshes, stream banks, and wet meadows. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture. Prenanthes polymorpha is an annual plant that blooms from late summer to early autumn.
